episode_title: 102 - The One With the Sonogram at the End

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What you guys don’t understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, right!……Y’serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Absolutely.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y’know? I mean it’s like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, and-and it’s not that we don’t like the comedian, it’s that-that… that’s not why we bought the ticket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The problem is, though, after the concert’s over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y’know? I mean, we’re in the car, we’re fighting traffic… basically just trying to stay awake.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, word of advice: Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you’re gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …Are we still talking about sex?

content.description: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker (Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s good, it is good, it’s just that- mm- doesn’t she seem a little angry?

content.speaker: Marsha
content.text: Well, she has issues.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Does she.

content.speaker: Marsha
content.text: He’s out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like ‘Gee, that glacier’s getting kinda close.’ See?

content.speaker: Marsha
content.text: Speaking of issues, isn’t that your ex-wife?
(Carol, Ross’s ex-wife, has entered behind them and is standing outstide the exhibit.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No.

content.speaker: Marsha
content.text: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I’ll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.
(Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: So.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You look great. I, uh… I hate that.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Sorry. You look good too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, well, in here, anyone who… stands erect… So what’s new? Still, uh…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: A lesbian?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well… you never know. How’s, um.. how’s the family?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Marty’s still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why- why are you here, Carol?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I’m pregnant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pregnant?!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three’s Company.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three’s Company where there’s some kind of misunderstanding.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …Then I’ve already seen this one! (Turns off the TV.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you through with that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whose little ball of paper is this?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn’t need it, so I balled it up and… (sees that Monica is glaring at him) …now I wish I was dead.
(Monica starts to fluff a pillow.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s already fluffed that pillow… Monica, you know, you’ve already fluffed that- (Monica glares at her.) -but, it’s fine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look , I’m sorry, guys, I just don’t wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child’s pillow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica- Hi! Um, Monica, you’re scaring me. I mean, you’re like, you’re like all chaotic and twirly. And not-not in a good way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, calm down. You don’t see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. Y’see, he’s the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Eeaagh!
(Rachel enters from her room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Has anybody seen my engagement ring?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s beautiful.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God… (Starts to look under the couch cushions.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, look, don’t touch that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, like I wasn’t dreading tomorrow enough, having to give it back to him… “Hi Barry! Remember me? I’m the girl in the veil who stomped on your heart in front of your entire family!” Oh God and now I’m gonna have to return the ring, without the ring, which makes it so much harder…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Easy Rach, we’ll find it. (To all) Won’t we!

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Oh! Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, when’d’ya have it on last?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Doy! Probably right before she lost it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t get a lot of ’doy’ these days…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the kitchen with…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Dinah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhhh, don’t be mad…
content.parenthetical: looks at the lasagne and realizes something

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I am sorry…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gave you one job! (Starts to examin the lasagne through the bottom of the glass pan.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, Monica, you know that’s not how you look for an engagement ring in a lasagne…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just… can’t do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Boys? We’re going in.
(Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe start to pick through the lasagne as there’s a knock on the door which Monica answers.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. That is not a happy hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol’s pregnant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! I found it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: W-w-wh-… wha-… w-w-w-…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now. (He enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well now, how-how do you fit into this whole thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved, but if I’m not comfortable with it, I don’t have to be involved.. basically it’s entirely up to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She is so great! I miss her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What does she mean by ‘involved’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, they want me to go down to this- sonogram thing with them tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I’m still gonna be a father.
(Joey starts to eat the rest of the lasagne and everyone turns and stares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …Well, this is still ruined, right?

content.description: [Scene, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Ross are pouring wine for their parents.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, Martha Ludwin’s daughter is gonna call you. (Tastes a snack) Mmm! What’s that curry taste?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Curry.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Mmmm!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I- I think they’re great! I, I really do.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Do you remember the Ludwins? The big one had a thing for you, didn’t she?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: They all had a thing for him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw, Mom…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, why is this girl going to call me?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking, or food, or… I don’t know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant-

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Mom, I don’t have a restaurant, I work in a restaurant.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, they don’t have to know that… (She starts to fluff the same pillow Monica fluffed multiple times earlier.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti, please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. (They go to the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, we’re having spaghetti! That’s… easy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish, but, were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me.
[Time Lapse, everyone is now eating.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What that Rachel did to her life… We ran into her parents at the club, they were not playing very well.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’m not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding… but forty thousand dollars is a lot of money!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Nothing! It’s an expression.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it’s not.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Don’t listen to your mother. You’re independent, and you always have been! Even when you were a kid… and you were chubby, and you had no friends, you were just fine! And you would read alone in your room, and your puzzles…
[Time Lapse.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Look, there are people like Ross who need to shoot for the stars, with his museum, and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are- I’m telling you, these are the people who never get cancer.
[Time Lapse.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: …And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God ‘Our Little Harmonica’ doesn’t seem to have that problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, Ross, what’s going on with you? Any stories? (Digs her elbow into his hand.) No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?
content.parenthetical: trying desperately to change the subject

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay. (To his parents) Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here’s the deal. Carol’s a lesbian. She’s living with a woman named Susan. She’s pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.
(Stunned silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: And you knew about this?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your folks are really that bad, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, y’know, these people are pros. They know what they’re doing, they take their time, they get the job done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Boy, I know they say you can’t change your parents,… boy, if you could- (To Ross) -I’d want yours.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Must pee. (Goes to pee.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, it’s even worse when you’re twins.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re twins?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. We don’t speak. She’s like this high-powered, driven career type.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does she do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s a waitress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, you guys, I kinda gotta clean up now. (They all start to leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, you’re an only child, right? You don’t have any of this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who… my parents actually preferred.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The lights, please..
(Joey turns off the lights, and they all leave as Rachel starts to clean up. Ross enters from the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …How long was I in there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just cleaning up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: D’ya.. uh.. d’ya need any help?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh.. okay, sure! Thanks! (She hands him the broom and sits down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway.. um.. (Starts to sweep.) So, you- uh- you nervous about Barry tomorrow?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.. a little..

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mm-hmm..

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, got any advice? Y’know, as someone who’s recently been- dumped?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you may wanna steer clear of the word ‘dumped’. Chances are he’s gonna be this, this broken shell of a man, y’know, so you should try not to look too terrific, I know it’ll be hard. Or, y’know, uh, hey!, I’ll go down there, and I’ll give Barry back his ring, and you can go with Carol and Susan to the OB/GYN…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you’ve got Carol tomorrow.. When did it get so complicated?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Got me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remember when we were in high school together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, didn’t you think you were just gonna meet somone, fall in love- and that’d be it? (Ross gazes at her.) ..Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Man, I never thought I’d be here.. (She leans back onto his hand.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Me either… (He pulls up a stool so that he doesn’t have to move his hand.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry I’m late, I was stuck at work. There was this big dinosaur.. thing.. anyway.
(Susan enters holding a drink.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross, you remember Susan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How could I forget?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello, Susan. (To Carol) Good shake. Good shake. So, uh, we’re just waiting for…?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Dr. Oberman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ..Dr. Oberman. Okay. And is he-

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: She.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: -she, of course, she- uh- familiar with our.. special situation?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yes, and she’s very supportive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that’s great. (Susan gives her drink to Carol.) No, I’m- Oh.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Quack, quack..
content.parenthetical: picks up a surgical instrament and mimes a duck with it

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross? That opens my cervix. (He drops it in horror.)

content.description: [Scene Barry’s office, Barry is working on patient, Robbie, as Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barry?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: C’mon in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Yeah! It’s fine, it’s fine. Robbie’s gonna be here for hours.

content.speaker: Robbie
content.text: Huh?!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: So, how ya doin?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m- uh- I’m okay… You look great!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Yeah, well..

content.speaker: Bernice
content.text: Dr. Farber, Jason Greenstein’s gagging.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Be right there. (To Robbie and Rachel) Be back in a sec.
(As Barry exits Robbie stares at Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I dumped him.

content.speaker: Robbie
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Carol’s OB/GYN, they’re talking about how this is going to work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, um- so how’s this, uh, how’s this gonna work? Y’know, with us? Y’know, when, like, important decisions have to be made?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Give me a ‘for instance’.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, uh, uh, I don’t know, okay, okay, how about with the, uh, with the baby’s name?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Marlon-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marlon?!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: -if it’s a boy, Minnie if it’s a girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …As in Mouse?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: As in my grandmother.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Still, you- you say Minnie, you hear Mouse. Um, how about, um.. how about Julia?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Julia..

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: We agreed on Minnie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ’s’funny, um, uh, we agreed we’d spend the rest of our lives together. Things change, roll with the punches. I believe Julia’s on the table…?

content.description: Barry’s office, Rachel is doing her makeup in the mirror on Barry’s lamp as Barry enters.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Sorry about that. So. What have you been up to?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, not much. I-I got a job.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Oh, that’s great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why are- why are you so tanned?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Oh, I, uh- I went to Aruba.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no. You went on our honeymoon alone?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: No. I went with, uh.. Now, this may hurt.

content.speaker: Robbie
content.text: Me?!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: No! (To Rachel) I went with Mindy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mindy?! My maid of honour, Mindy?!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Yeah, well, uh, we’re kind of a thing now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Well, um.. (Grabs his forehand) You’ve got plugs!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Careful! They haven’t quite taken yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you’ve got lenses! But you hate sticking your finger in your eye!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Not for her. Listen, I really wanted to thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay..

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: See, about a month ago, I wanted to hurt you. More than I’ve ever wanted to hurt anyone in my life. And I’m an orthodontist.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: You know, you were right? I mean, I thought we were happy. We weren’t happy. But with Mindy, now I’m happy. Spit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Robbie
content.text: Me. (Spits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, um, (Gets the ring out of her purse.) I guess this belongs to you. And thank you for giving it to me.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Well, thank you for giving it back.
(Barry and Rachel look at each other.)

content.speaker: Robbie
content.text: Hello?!

content.description: Carol’s OB/GYN, they’re still arguing about what to name the baby.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, please! What’s wrong with Helen?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Helen Geller? I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hello? It’s not gonna be Helen Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: No, I mean it’s not Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, it’s gonna be Helen Willick?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: It’s my baby too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, ’s’funny, really? Um, I don’t remember you making any sperm.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: All right, you two, stop it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I’m in there too.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross. You’re not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? ’Cause I think that borders on child abuse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course not, I’m… suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he’s doing? He knows no-one’s gonna say all those names, so they’ll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I ever imagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y’know what? Uh, um, this is too hard. I’m not, I can’t do-

content.speaker: Dr. Oberman
content.text: Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah. Yeah. A little.

content.speaker: Dr. Oberman
content.text: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You- uh- y’know what, I’m gonna go. I don’t- I don’t think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.
(He turns to go, but the sound of the sonogram catches hes ear. He returns and stares at it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Look at that.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I know.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram. Rachel is on the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well? Isn’t that amazing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are we supposed to be seeing here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I dunno, but.. I think it’s about to attack the Enterprise.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then don’t do that, alright?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica. Whaddya think?
content.parenthetical: walks over to where Monica is standing

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mm-hmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh- are you welling up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You are, you’re welling up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Am not!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re gonna be an aunt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh shut up!
content.parenthetical: pushes him and starts to cry

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it’s Rachel. Yeah, I’m fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it’s okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y’know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. (Slams the phone down.) (To everyone) Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.
